header.title: The Scroll of Set, Issue Number 159, Volume XXIV-5, October 1998
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Left-Hand Path

central_thesis: The 'Scroll of Set' articulates a dynamic and evolving esoteric system centered on individual self-deification (Xeper) and the conscious expansion of isolate intelligence, offering diverse practical and philosophical avenues for its Initiates to manifest their will and become 'Set-like' agents of the Prince of Darkness in the world, while also fostering community and intellectual discourse within the Temple of Set.

structure_content.summary: Provides practical guidance for organizing Setian events, emphasizing meticulous planning, effective scheduling (including 'slack time' and breaks), and the importance of being a 'gracious host' to ensure a positive and productive atmosphere for attendees.

Explores 'postmodernism' as a cultural and philosophical phenomenon, discussing its origins, key theorists, and characteristics such as de-centered imagery and the opposition of 'centrality' versus 'marginality,' suggesting its utility in assessing diverse information and understanding cultural dynamics.

A philosophical-poetic piece advocating resistance against societal mediocrity and indoctrination, calling for an 'alien elite' to emerge and challenge the 'faceless society' and its 'blighted dreams of a uniform culture,' asserting individual power over collective conformity.

Introduces a new Pylon within the Temple of Set dedicated to the 'mystery of expansion of consciousness' through 'cooperative individualism,' aiming for the intellectual comprehension, intuitive apprehension, and practical realization of isolate intelligence (Xeper) as a path to victory over appearance.

structure_content.chapter_title: On the Use of Ritual Tools
structure_content.summary: Discusses the role of ritual tools in Black Magic, arguing that while they can provide atmosphere, they are not essential requirements. The author advocates for a 'more magic, less method' approach, emphasizing the importance of internal will and mental state over external aids for effective Greater Black Magic and Xeper.

Articulates the core purpose of the Temple of Set as facilitating individual 'Becoming' (Xeper). It explains the III° Priesthood as a 'merging of consciousness' with the Prince of Darkness, transforming the Initiate into an agent of Set with the responsibility to foster individuation in others, thereby expanding Set's influence.

Introduces an Order within the Temple of Set focused on Vedic Left-Hand Path traditions and 'Setian Black Yoga.' This 'Dark Transcendence' is a four-fold process aiming for an Initiate's mastery over body, mind, emotions, and spirit to realize their isolate nature and achieve initiatory balance.

structure_content.chapter_title: A Realm of Gods at Play: The Dance of Xeper and Xem
structure_content.summary: Interprets 'Xem' as a highly advanced and refined state of Xeper, representing apotheosis and the recognition of one's own divinity. It suggests Xem is both the individual's manifestation of godhood and an interactive realm of higher beings, accessible subjectively as a dynamic, ongoing process.

structure_content.chapter_title: Getting Yourself Ordained: A Primer to the Priesthood
structure_content.summary: Provides detailed definitions of core Setian terms (Xeper, Essence, State of Being, Recognition, etc.) and elucidates the qualitative transformation an Initiate undergoes to reach the III° Priesthood. It emphasizes the obligations, responsibilities, and character required of a Priest/Priestess to serve the Temple's success and manifest Set's will.

Critiques the casual application of the title 'Magus' to pop-culture figures, stressing that true Magi facilitate a fundamental, world-altering change in the human condition through their 'Word' and work, embodying essential nobility and wisdom rather than mere charisma.

structure_content.chapter_title: Order of the Wells of Wyrd
structure_content.summary: Introduces an Order based on Norse cosmology, focusing on the 'Flow of Wyrd' as a dynamic, non-linear causality that sculpts destiny. Practices involve exploring altered states of consciousness, developing body/kinesthetic awareness, and constructing symbolic structures to understand and direct personal destiny.

key_concepts.definition: A discontinuous, non-linear, integral, and non-incremental process whereby one experiences a distinct alteration in State of Being; a self-willed and directed process of conscious becoming.
The core self; not specific in time or place; eternal and immutable; the monad; the subject entity of 'Essent into Essence'.

The self- and other-perceived personality, restricted to a specific time and place; the aggregate of interdependent traits that comprise the personality; the Essence as modified by those added traits acting as appendages, shells, or masks; changeable as a result of Xeper.

The art of continuous perception of the Remanifest State of Being of an Initiate by senior Initiates, leading to the designation of an appropriate degree as a result of that perception. This is the Magistry's prerogative and obligation.

A state of being (degree) signifying a qualitative change from an independent, egocentric existence to an interdependent, 'ego-eccentric' existence. It involves a personal intervention by Set, an obligation to the Temple, and a responsibility to expand individuation in others, becoming an 'agency' for Set's ends.

A non-mechanistic attractor that works on consciousness and events. It is the single most powerful force an individual can possess if invoked without 'lust for results', operating independently of the mechanistic universe and capable of affecting thoughts and events by continually bringing thought back to a theme.

Greater Black Magic is internal transformation, connecting to the 'Powers of Darkness' using only the mind. Lesser Black Magic is influencing the external world by manipulating the wills of others, often by assuaging their pain or making them feel important.
The inherent, unnatural need within humans to be more than they are, exalted by the Temple of Set as the source of desire and power leading to self-deification.

A process, based on Vedic Left-Hand Path principles, for intelligently and deliberately applying natural laws to daily life to realize one's individual isolate nature. It encompasses various paths (Hatha, Laya, Mantra, Jnana, Bhakti, Karma, Raja, Luciferian, Meta) to achieve 'Dark Transcendence'.

A highly advanced and refined state of Xeper, representing apotheosis and the individual's recognition of their own divinity. It is described as both the god one manifests and a dynamic, interactive realm of higher beings.

In Norse cosmology, the dynamic flow of patterns and the movement of the patterning principle that sculpts the future out of all actions that have become. It is a non-linear causality, transcending Newtonian cause-and-effect.

practical_system.description: The Temple of Set's practical system, as outlined in this issue, is an individualized, Left-Hand Path approach to self-deification (Xeper). It emphasizes conscious transformation through the cultivation of isolate intelligence and personal will, aiming to manifest one's unique divinity. This involves both internal (Greater Black Magic) and external (Lesser Black Magic) operative work, supported by philosophical understanding and specific practices within various internal Orders (e.g., Order of the Black Tower, Order of the Wells of Wyrd, Re-Setaue Pylon). The ultimate goal is to become an agent of Set, expanding individuation in the world.
tools: Internal Will: The most potent tool for directing consciousness and influencing events.
Isolate Intelligence: Conscious awareness and self-knowledge as foundational for Xeper.
Specific 'Words': Act as initiatory tools, such as 'Xeper' itself, which instigate transformation by merely contemplating their defined meaning.
Self-reflection and Study: Engagement with Setian texts and philosophy, including the 'Crystal Tablet' and publications like 'The Scroll of Set', to deepen understanding and facilitate Xeper.
External Ritual Tools (optional): Robes, swords, candles, gongs are acknowledged for atmospheric purposes but are ultimately transcended as the magician progresses towards internal mastery.
rituals: Greater Black Magic: Internal work connecting to the 'Powers of Darkness' using only the mind, transcending reliance on external ritual tools.
Lesser Black Magic: Influencing others by manipulating their perception of self-importance or power to achieve desired external outcomes.

Setian Black Yoga (Dark Transcendence): A multi-faceted process encompassing Hatha (physical control), Laya (psychic centers), Mantra (mind-steadying 'Words'), Jnana (knowledge), Bhakti (devotion to self/ideal), Karma (self-determined action), Raja (mental/spiritual discipline), Luciferian (isolating self to appreciate totality of psyche), and Meta (transcending subjectivity).

Working with Wyrd: Practices involving the exploration of altered states of consciousness (meditative, hypnotic, dream, trance), development of body/kinesthetic awareness, and the construction of symbolic structures to understand and direct personal destiny.

relevant_quotes.text: If you are undergoing Xeper, the size of what you can cause to happen in the world must continually increase.
The III° is the “merging of the consciousness, indeed the personality, with that of the Prince of Darkness himself”.
Priesthood has its own special demands and rewards. It is the first of the degrees in which Set himself intervenes on a personal level between the Initiate and himself.
The purpose of the Temple of Set is to give permission from the self to the self to seek after its own Becoming.
Man cannot move, think, or speak of his own accord. He is a marionette pulled here and there by invisible strings.
If a Word is Uttered, the essence of that Magus' work will be locked within that Word.
One is never supposed to wake sleepwalkers. One can kill them from the shock, it's said.

critical_analysis.relevance: The 'Scroll of Set' provides a rich, multi-faceted insight into the philosophical and practical evolution of the Temple of Set's esoteric system in 1998. It demonstrates an active, intellectual engagement with core Setian concepts (Xeper, Priesthood, Black Magic) while integrating diverse influences from neurobiology, postmodernism, Vedic traditions (Left-Hand Path Yoga), and Norse mythology (Wyrd). It illustrates the internal discourse and development of specific Orders within the Temple, offering varied pathways for individuation and self-deification, thereby contributing to the documented history of modern occultism.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Primarily active Initiates of the Temple of Set, especially those at the Adept (II°) degree contemplating or progressing towards the Priesthood (III°), or those interested in the philosophical and practical nuances of various internal Orders. It also serves as a valuable resource for scholars of contemporary Western Esotericism and Left-Hand Path organizations.
